availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Educational institution for deaf and hard-of-hearing students in Danville, Boyle County, Kentucky. Created by an act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on April 10, 1823. Governed by the Board of Trustees of Centre College until 1870. Superintendents from 1860 to 1865: John Adamson Jacobs (1835-1869).

ab.bibl:
JoAnn Hamm, "History of Kentucky School for the Deaf," Kentucky School for the Deaf, https://www.ksd.k12.ky.us/content/history (accessed April 27, 2020).
John W. Hudson, Jr., "Kentucky School for the Deaf" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 511-512.
